title: Add validation scripts to CI
description:
Discovery Source: Release process e2e audit
Discovered During: research phase

Impact:
Validation scripts (check-plugin-health, check-platform-parity, doctor-docs)
only run during release or manual invocation. Adding them to CI would catch
version drift and parity issues earlier.

Context:
Currently no CI gate runs before release. CI only covers opencode plugin changes.

title: Add rollback on partial release failure
description:
Discovery Source: Release process e2e audit
Discovered During: research phase

Impact:
If release.py fails mid-pipeline, modified files are left dirty. Currently
prints rollback hint but could auto-rollback with git checkout on failure.

Context:
Low priority — single maintainer can easily run git checkout manually.
The rollback hint added in this session is sufficient for now.

title: Strengthen changelog format validation in doctor-docs
description:
Discovery Source: Release process e2e audit
Discovered During: research phase

Impact:
doctor-docs.py only warns if keepachangelog.com isn't referenced. Does not
validate date format (ISO 8601), SemVer version sections, or comparison
link structure. Could catch malformed changelogs before release.

Context:
Current leniency hasn't caused issues but is a gap in validation coverage.

title: Extract shared run_cmd/run_bd_json into helper module
description:
Discovery Source: Harden helper scripts session
Discovered During: serve phase (sous-chef review, 3 rounds)

Impact:
run_cmd is copy-pasted identically across all 6 helper scripts.
run_bd_json is duplicated across 3 scripts. Growing maintenance cost
if the pattern needs updating (e.g. adding timeout config).

Context:
Scripts are standalone by design (no import dependencies), which is
the right choice for a plugin system. But at 6+ copies, extraction
into a shared helpers.py in the scripts directory would reduce drift.
Not urgent — only worth doing if more scripts are added.
